key_points: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (AOC) criticized Facebook during its blackout, highlighting its monopolistic behavior.
AOC emphasized Facebook's history of acquiring or destroying competitors like WhatsApp and Instagram.
She argued that Facebook's unchecked power harms democracy and free society.
Forbes editor José Caparroso remarked on the significant impact of the blackout in Latin America, given the widespread use of WhatsApp.
Despite alternatives like Viber, the outage underscored the tech giant's influence.
Facebook faces an antitrust lawsuit by the Federal Trade Commission, challenging its monopolistic practices.
Facebook defended itself, claiming no antitrust laws were violated, with a judge's decision expected by mid-November.
The company's content moderation policies and their impact on national discourse are under scrutiny.
The outage, beginning Monday at noon, was likely due to an issue with Facebook's Domain Name System.
Mark Zuckerberg's personal wealth dropped by $6 billion due to the outage, reducing his fortune to around the GDP of Angola.
